intro: Hieracium prolatatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium prolatatum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a weed in some regions.
